intro: Ammi broussonetii, commonly known as Indian psoralea, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with a distinctive aromatic scent. It is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
